descript.abstract: There are no official zip code areas in Germany. Zip codes are related only to streets but the first digit of their zip codes are organized into ten zones that cover Germany. Germany One-Digit Zip Code Zones (PLZgrenzen) represent these ten areas.
descript.purpose: Germany One-Digit Zip Code Zones (PLZgrenzen) provides the ten zones of Germany that each encloses all streets with the same first digit of their zip codes.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

This means that the data are only available for Harvard Afiliates for use on Harvard owned computers. The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps CD-ROMs for use with ESRI(r) software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. The redistribution rights for this data set: (c) 1998-2000 ESRI Geoinformatik GmbH, Germany, under license of infas GeoDaten GmbH, Germany. Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 909-793-3774; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded. Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is exported using Avenue request ExportClean. This request verifies and enforces the correctness of shapes.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of the coordinates does not exceed +/- 150 meters.

procstep.procdesc: There are no official zip code areas in Germany. Zip codes (Postleitzahl, PLZ) are only related to streets. To build the areas called zones, ESRI Geoinformatik GmbH digitized from topographic maps using community boundaries where possible, digitized from street lines inside cities and communities containing several zip codes, and used free interpretation.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from ESRI PLZgrenzen 2000. Converted an attribute from number to string, reduced its width, and renamed it to Zone. Created ArcGIS(tm) layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView Avenue request ExportClean, and created spatial indices.
Source shape files were loaded into SDE using the shp2sde command by the HGL team. Spatial reference options -180,-90,1000000.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent Germany divided into 10 zones based on the first digit of street-based zip codes (Postleitzahl, PLZ).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports ArcView(r) GIS shapefiles.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
